question: who founded mission nuestra senora de la soledad
api_result: Mission Nuestra Señora de la Soledad, also known as Mission Soledad, was founded by the Spanish Franciscan priest Fermín Francisco de Lasuén on October 9, 1791. It is located in what is now the town of Soledad, California. This mission was the thirteenth of the twenty-one Spanish missions established in what is now the state of California. These missions were part of Spain's efforts to colonize and evangelize the Pacific coast of North America.
